page.title: 08RECREATION IN MARFORD
page.content: There is a playground opposite the Rofft School.It has : A slide for young children and a bigger one for older children.Small and big swings, climbing frames,tubes,logs,a rocking ship and foot-ball goal-posts.There is also a large grass area for picnics, etc.People go there for enjoyment and most children have good times there and there are hardly any accidents.I think that the playground has made good use of that land. The Rofft School holds Brownies on Wednesdays and Thursdays.Brownies are for the 7-10 year olds and they go on short walks,play games and lots more.The girls enjoy themselves here. For fifteen pence an hour they have good fun. Guides(10-14) are held on Wednesdays at the Methodist Church.They go on rambles, have cook-ups & go camping.
